intro: Arachnothryx subglabra, commonly known as the smooth arachnothryx, is a tropical tree species native to regions of South America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and is valued for its timber and medicinal properties. Its smooth bark and slender leaves make it easily distinguishable from other members of the genus.
